main event: A radar sighting of an object circling near the center of Culver City, California, on 13 February 1964.
interesting points: The object was observed for 15 minutes circling and changing direction at a 35-degree angle., Witnesses described the object as extremely small, about the size of a dime., Weather conditions were clear with seven miles visibility., The observation took place during normal air traffic conditions from several busy municipal airports., No follow-up identification actions were attempted after the sighting.
sighted object: a round object about the size of a dime
